A view from the bottom of the new river channel being excavated at the Victoria Ground in #StokeonTrent. The tree roots embedded into the banks and river bed will provide shelter for fish and habitat niches for aquatic wildlife. @EnvAgencyMids @SoTCityCouncil @theriverstrust https://t.co/8xYXSFZP3b

Augmentation at Ivel Springs is therefore essential, but not at feeble 0.4 ML rate proposed by @AffinityWater - which is less even than the Q90 figure calculated by @EnvAgency. The new borehole must have capacity to augment at 5 ML.
@EnvAgency talk of cost-benefit analysis and say reducing over-abstraction is too expensive. Only a token cap on abstraction at Baldock will be applied.
@EnvAgency  guy: "They're 'Poor' status in the River Basin Management Plan. That's a fact. We can't deny that. The cost of addressing that has been deemed disproportionately too high as it is."
@EnvAgency guy: "We know that all of these ground water bodies for the west of our area (EAnglia) are failing presently to meet their environmental objectives."
@EnvAgency guy: "We know that most of our ground water bodies are over-licensed, over-abstracted."
